reason: Node 1.1 appears to be a summary of the individual computations that are detailed in sibling nodes 1.2, 1.3, and 1.4. This creates structural redundancy in the proof tree - the same claims are made at this level and then repeated in more detail in the child nodes. Consider whether this node should: (a) only claim that 'each h_i permutes B_0 setwise' and defer the specific mappings to 1.2-1.4, or (b) be restructured so 1.2-1.4 are children that prove the individual cases claimed here.
